The figure shows <LU LEMMA="plane" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">plane</LU> P with <LU LEMMA="light" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">light</LU> travelling from <LU LEMMA="source" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="p">sources</LU> S1 and S2. The <LU LEMMA="fringe" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">fringe</LU> <LU LEMMA="width" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">width</LU> is the <LU LEMMA="spacing" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">spacing</LU> between... 
neighboring high and <LU LEMMA="low" CAT="A">low</LU> <LU LEMMA="intensity" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">intensity</LU> <LU LEMMA="peaks" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">peaks</LU>.
neighboring high <LU LEMMA="intensity" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">intensity</LU> <LU LEMMA="peaks" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">peaks</LU> or <LU LEMMA="low" CAT="A">low</LU> <LU LEMMA="intensity" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">intensity</LU> <LU LEMMA="peaks" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">peaks</LU>.
zero-<LU LEMMA="order" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">order</LU> <LU LEMMA="maximum" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">maximum</LU> and the first <LU LEMMA="intensity" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">intensity</LU> <LU LEMMA="minimum" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">minimum</LU>.
zero-<LU LEMMA="order" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">order</LU> <LU LEMMA="maximum" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">maximum</LU> and the <LU LEMMA="point" CAT="A">point</LU> of <LU LEMMA="observation" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">observation</LU>.
